entry.title: Orienteering League & Nationals wrap-up
entry.summary: The second round of the National Orienteering League was held at the NZ Orienteering Championships, including both the Middle and Long distances. With this being the highest attendance of all events this year competition was fierce at the top of the table. Both days featured extremely challenging courses that caused many mistakes and misspunches among […] Orienteering League & Nationals wrap-up first appeared on Orienteering New Zealand.

entry.summary: How should you act if you know the terrain before a race, meet an injured runner in the forest or are asked for directions? entry.title: South West League
entry.summary: The new South West League is a replacement for the old Munster League. The big plus is that it reduces distances to events and takes advantage of the improved N22 road network. The league has been established by the Cork and Kerry orienteering clubs and is designed to encourage members to travel to the events […] The post South West League first appeared on Orienteering in Ireland.

entry.title: Sprinting Through Dublin: A Weekend of Intensive Orienteering Training
entry.summary: Over the weekend, the national squad of Orienteering Ireland convened in Dublin for an intensive sprint camp aimed at sharpening their skills and refining their strategies. entry.title: Independent athlete participation in World Ranking Events
entry.summary: Following consultation with the Member Federations and IOF Athlete Representatives, the IOF Council has unanimously approved to open up for independent athlete participation in World Ranking Events through IIA status for eligible athletes.
